content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun & enough  for coc

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun clash, simple enough, but not trivial (for instance one can slip on double-counting tiles on the edges). My comments below are now fixed.

Something more important: when at first I solved the clash, I forgot to multiply the speed by "duration" and still passed all the tests and all the validators! You need to include an example where forgetting about the duration changes the outcome of the race.

I like the clash, I think the non-conventional rules for the race make it fun. Just two suggestions:
- I would change the validators to make each outcome more or less equally probable. Imagine I can't solve the problem at all, but simply submit "output DRAW", thinking "well, at least I'll score around 30%". With the current validators, I would still get a 75% score!
- The expression "closer (in any direction)" made me wonder if directions perpendicular to the race path are also allowed: would in this 8x2 example the rabbit win because it's closer to the finish line in the vertical direction?
##F###T#
##R#####
Probably I'm just overthinking it, but I would change "in any direction" with "in either direction"

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like it!
Simple enough for CoC, all tests pass except the last one if you don't pay attention to the length of the arena, which is a good thing.
